pivot_contrib.guretzki
Class BlockingDialog

java.lang.Object
  pivot_contrib.guretzki.BlockingDialog

@DefaultProperty(value="content")
public class BlockingDialog
extends java.lang.Object

Can host any Dialog outside of the normal Application HostFrame; this way, awt is used to do the open(Display) in a blocking way, i. e. the flow of control doesn't return before the content Dialog is closed.

The content can be set in the constructor or (e. g. via bxml) using setContent(Dialog).
Both sAlert(org.apache.pivot.wtk.MessageType, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.pivot.wtk.Display, java.lang.Object...) Methods construct and open an Alert inside this host.

Author:
thomas.guretzki

open

public org.apache.pivot.wtk.Dialog open(org.apache.pivot.wtk.Display display)
Open Dialog and return Content. User's choice can be derived by Dialog.getResult() and Alert.getSelectedOption().

Parameters:
display - determines the opening position of the host
Returns:
Content containing the user's choice.
